column4: I have some questions that begin "What distro is best for ...". Is there a channel that caters to these questions
most all the disrtos can do the same jobs.. some are just designed with a specific job in mind from the start. :)   so often the best is the one that you know best.
!apt-get
I know mepis best but I don't think I want to use it as a web/dns server.
you could...
not saying I couldn't.
and from what i gatehr Mepis is  basicially using all the ubuntu repos/packages now.. and some extras..
of course the heart of the disrtos are the apt-get system I guess..and the debian  type core..   the rest is just frosting on the server-cake :)
Great, debian it is.
thats always good. :P   of course once ya learn the fundamentals.. the rest is easy
My nokia runs debian, my laptop runs debian, and my future web/dns server runs debian... if only it could run IOS like my routers
my NSLU2 runs a debian variant now. :P
NSLU2?
a little fileserver. has 2 usb ports for hard drives.. by Linksys. about $80
cool deal I will have to check it out.
reccomended mirror for debian? Or should I use torrent?
your speeds may vary. :P my torrent speeds are always slow. :(
!vi
esc :wq
:help    -- is handy to rember in vi as well
NerdStar :)
my torrent speeds are also slow...should I suspect throttling?
no idea there.. ive gotten good speeds on some torrents.. like ISO's when first released...  so it all depends on the torrents i guess
